### Masking maps for landscape genomics

```{r setup}
library(landgen)
library(raster)
library(rgeos)
library(here)
library(tidyverse)
# devtools::load_all()
```

Often, we may want to mask areas of maps to visualize landscape genomics results. For example, we may want to mask areas beyond a study organism's range, or in areas that are undersampled (or not sampled).
